It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of many shrubs in the Rubiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions of Taiwan. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
